body: Thanks for reporting. I will look into it.

```
semantic error: Arguments do not match for any generic procedure, conjg
   --> /home/pranavchiku/scipy/scipy/linalg/src/id_dist/src/idzr_rid.f:144:22
    |
144 |             r(j,k) = conjg(y(k))
    |                      ^^^^^^^^^^^ 
```

> ```
> semantic error: Arguments do not match for any generic procedure, conjg
>    --> /home/pranavchiku/scipy/scipy/linalg/src/id_dist/src/idzr_rid.f:144:22
>     |
> 144 |             r(j,k) = conjg(y(k))
>     |                      ^^^^^^^^^^^ 
> ```

This is the last error for ```scipy/linalg/src/id_dist/src/idzr_rid.f```
I guess in this one we have to make an implementation to support the passing of a ```Function``` in a ```Function``` will try to do that by tomorrow :)
`y` is an array, `conjg` is an intrinsic
Aah crap! yes

Good catch, but I think there's something to be done about casting rules instead of introducing magic constants to fix this :)
Yeah, my minor tests are ongoing so will try to have a look tonight :)
What actually ```m_kind``` signifies in [comment](https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/issues/694#issuecomment-1233155608)?
I am not actually getting why both ```m_kind```s are not getting equal, help and suggestions please :)
Well, what number (ie. type are you getting for both)?

For a2 - 16
b2 - 8

issue.title: Add support for ```Variable``` symbol

labels.name: SciPy
labels.description: issues related to enable LFortran to compile the entire FORTRAN codebase in SciPy

issue.body:

body: Ok so the precision does not match -- maybe we can downcast and throw a warning about loss of information then?
I guess we can do that, but it still fails for ```llvm``` because of ```complex*16```
Please elaborate, I don't quite follow.
@Pranavchiku Would you please explain a little more? :)
yeah sure! I am currently in lab session will elaborate as soon as I get free :)

What I actually mean is that as ```complex*16``` is not yet supported by ```lfortran``` hence it fails for ```llvm```, apart from this downcast can be done but ondrej told something in different way that I actually can't remember.
Sorry for so much delayed response :/
Still not sure what this is issue is about. Is it still reproduceable?
I will check if it is still, will report that as soon as possible
@Pranavchiku  ?
